revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-25 08:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': "[Fullstack] Add block test until IPs will be really configured

In securitygroups fullstack test dhcp agent is used to configure
IP addresses inside FakeMachines.
During preparation to test, when such fake vms are created,
they are only blocked until boot - so until port becomes ACTIVE
in Neutron's database.
This patch adds also blocking vms until IP address is really
configured on each of such VMs.
If IP address will be not configured then we should at least have
better error message then error that nc process cannot be started.

Change-Id: I709b1489132edba932a4c73bea60f810c26011fa
Related-Bug: #1744402
"}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Add block test until IPs will be really configured

In securitygroups fullstack test dhcp agent is used to configure
IP addresses inside FakeMachines.
During preparation to test, when such fake vms are created,
they are only blocked until boot - so until port becomes ACTIVE
in Neutron's database.
This patch adds also blocking vms until IP address is really
configured on each of such VMs.
If IP address will be not configured then we should at least have
better error message then error that nc process cannot be started.

Change-Id: I709b1489132edba932a4c73bea60f810c26011fa
Related-Bug: #1744402

commit_message:
Ensure _get_changed_synthetic_fields() return updatable fields

Currently _get_changed_synthetic_fields() does not guarantee
returned fields to be updatable. This patch adds this guarantee.

Change-Id: I123ae390bec489a931180a2e33f4bf7b1d51edb2
Closes-Bug: #1750353

commit_message:
Fix to enable --color option of ostestr command

This commit fixes to enable --color option of ostestr command. The
option was broken with switching to use stestr commit. I'm actually not
sure how many users are still using this option. But this is just a bug.
If we do not support this option, we should remove it.

Change-Id: Id8b7afa0e343ac6303f6ec954abf6d62a76b4b79

commit_message:
Introduce Cyborg Resource Quota -- Usage Part

The concept of quota gives the possibility to limit the maximum number of
acceleration resources that one project/tenant can prossess.
It will also  give the admin users the ability to increase the resource count
on-demand, given that the system constraints are not exceeded.

Change-Id: I9ed3ec06290246ba7365eaeb97a5c4fc2916f538

subject: [Fullstack] Change time waiting for async ping results
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 17120, 'name': 'Manjeet Singh Bhatia', 'email': 'manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com', 'username': 'manjeets'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23312, 'name': 'kangyufei', 'email': 'kangyf@inspur.com', 'username': 'kangyufei'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 13:29:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/base.py'], 'message': '[Fullstack] Change time waiting for async ping results

During agents restart there is async ping run and there is
called function to wait until all async ping workers will
finish their job.

In TestHAL3Agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
there are 60 pings sent with 1 second timeout so default
wait_until_true timeout which is set to 60 seconds might not
be enough in some cases.
Because of that wait_until_true timeout is now set as
twice higher value than is needed to number of packets to send
with ping_timeout.

This should give enough time to finish all workers.

Change-Id: Ia7c3755c2ba5029bdab3c1dd30b305f3bde19740
Closes-Bug: #1775183
'}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Change time waiting for async ping results

During agents restart there is async ping run and there is
called function to wait until all async ping workers will
finish their job.

In TestHAL3Agent.test_ha_router_restart_agents_no_packet_lost
there are 60 pings sent with 1 second timeout so default
wait_until_true timeout which is set to 60 seconds might not
be enough in some cases.
Because of that wait_until_true timeout is now set as
twice higher value than is needed to number of packets to send
with ping_timeout.

This should give enough time to finish all workers.

Change-Id: Ia7c3755c2ba5029bdab3c1dd30b305f3bde19740
Closes-Bug: #1775183

commit_message:
Disable SSL messaging for neutron

For some reason, messaging over SSL is not working for neutron-server.
This is blocking integrated repo patches, so to unblock the repo while
the root cause is figured out, we disable SSL for now.

Change-Id: I0634644f7effe729b64489885fdb6b50dc68a911

subject: Add a hook for restore process to check if successful
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-07 11:58:50.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/base.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/mysql_impl.py', 'integration/scripts/functions_qemu', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_backups.py'], 'message': 'Add a hook for restore process to check if successful

1.This is the same solution with the backup process. Previously we only
check the stderr of the restore command, but this method is not
reliable, and the changes during percona-xtrabackup 2.4.11:
https://jira.percona.com/browse/PXB-1542
causes the gate jobs failed in creating a slave MySQL instance.

The new hook currently is only used by InnoBackupEx restore runner with
checking the exit status and stderr output of xbstream.

2.with[1] merged,this makes DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES more flexible, but it
break trovestack build image, now we need to specify a more
detailed path to DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES to get the appropriate content.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568697/

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>

Change-Id: I4e1e4401d40a664ab7fbba5bc08e13884cca06c2
'}]
commit_message:
Add a hook for restore process to check if successful

1.This is the same solution with the backup process. Previously we only
check the stderr of the restore command, but this method is not
reliable, and the changes during percona-xtrabackup 2.4.11:
https://jira.percona.com/browse/PXB-1542
causes the gate jobs failed in creating a slave MySQL instance.

The new hook currently is only used by InnoBackupEx restore runner with
checking the exit status and stderr output of xbstream.

2.with[1] merged,this makes DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES more flexible, but it
break trovestack build image, now we need to specify a more
detailed path to DIB_CLOUD_IMAGES to get the appropriate content.

[1]:https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568697/

Co-Authored-By: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Co-Authored-By: jiansong <jian.song@easystack.cn>

Change-Id: I4e1e4401d40a664ab7fbba5bc08e13884cca06c2

commit_message:
Expose instance_get_all_uuids_by_host() from DB API and use it

We've had a long-standing optimization point in the
InstanceList.get_uuids_by_host() method, where we pull the entire
list of instance objects only to strip and return the uuids. We
already had a query method for generating just the uuids in the
DB API, but it was not exposed as it was just a helper for another
method. This exposes it publicly and uses it in that InstanceList
method.

Change-Id: I35c05e78d59ec9b95c2a443979b8d66cd42ea043

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-05-18 21:36:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "Make instance.refresh() avoid recursion better

The instance.refresh() method is careful to prevent recursion, to avoid
lazy-loads on the object we just pulled from the database. However, it
was allowing those to raise OrphanedObjectError to the caller to make
them visible. The caller is not really at fault in that case, and can not
avoid it.

The only time this has ever come up is in the context of cellsv1 and the
keypairs field that it doesn't have set on instances in the child cells.
Thus, this changes refresh() to just skip fields that are set on the
current object and unset on the one we pull from the database, as we
would not be able to refresh those anyway. This logs the situation so that
it is visible (at DEBUG) if it becomes relevant.

Change-Id: Ibfca4ae922766b5b977e217594d12e1169ddeee8
"}]
commit_message:
Make instance.refresh() avoid recursion better

The instance.refresh() method is careful to prevent recursion, to avoid
lazy-loads on the object we just pulled from the database. However, it
was allowing those to raise OrphanedObjectError to the caller to make
them visible. The caller is not really at fault in that case, and can not
avoid it.

The only time this has ever come up is in the context of cellsv1 and the
keypairs field that it doesn't have set on instances in the child cells.
Thus, this changes refresh() to just skip fields that are set on the
current object and unset on the one we pull from the database, as we
would not be able to refresh those anyway. This logs the situation so that
it is visible (at DEBUG) if it becomes relevant.

Change-Id: Ibfca4ae922766b5b977e217594d12e1169ddeee8

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-29 11:50:04.000000000', 'files': ['roles/freeipa-setup/README.md', 'roles/freeipa-setup/templates/deploy_freeipa.sh.j2'], 'message': "Introduce a custom parameter to pass to ipa-server-install

Sometimes it would be nice to be able to pass extra parameters
to 'ipa-server-install'. Let's introduce the 'ipa_server_install_params'
parameter which will be passed as extra arguments to the freeipa
installation.

One of the use cases is being able to disable dnssec validation
(via the '--no-dnssec-validation' parameter)

Change-Id: I0b8d985b6442a183251d1c2a47a91fc2f5d0f978
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce a custom parameter to pass to ipa-server-install

Sometimes it would be nice to be able to pass extra parameters
to 'ipa-server-install'. Let's introduce the 'ipa_server_install_params'
parameter which will be passed as extra arguments to the freeipa
installation.

One of the use cases is being able to disable dnssec validation
(via the '--no-dnssec-validation' parameter)

Change-Id: I0b8d985b6442a183251d1c2a47a91fc2f5d0f978

commit_message:
Add logstash filters

This adds the ability to include logstash log parsing filters for
various openstack and service logs.  These filters are disabled by
default and can be enabled by toggling the deploy_logstash_filters
variable.

Change-Id: I5c46f78f232d3fb604283ae623cd3975a8346c7c

commit_message:
Rename test files to test_* pattern

We're going to switch to default Django test runner by default.
This patch renames test files to make tests descoverable by
Nose and Django test runners without addidional configuration.

Related blueprint: improve-horizon-testing

Change-Id: If4ee8dcd173c2f331bf34cf93c489029489c63ea

commit_message:
Increase accuracy of detecting apache install

The javascript-common package includes /etc/apache2/conf-available/javascript-common.conf
so it is not sufficiuent to use the presence of the /etc/apache2
directory as an indicator of apache being installed

Change-Id: Ia5c80b9842b0c9633d7ccda2837597d94d098df3

commit_message:
Bypass pip constraints when installing Elastic Curator

The elasticsearch-curator package requires certifi 2018.4.16 but this
is constrained to version 2018.1.18. Use isolated mode to allow
installation of the upstream version.

Change-Id: I4ba387afab35230e70b45fab42b6bfaf9ffeba19

commit_message:
ovn: Add dns_servers configuration support

networking-ovn optionally expects list of dns server to be defined in the
config -'ovn/dns_servers'. These will be included in the 'dns_server' DHCP
option field when the VMs send DHCP request if the subnet's dns_nameservers field
is not defined by the user.

Change-Id: I353ac905069ecc945720df2b9e3051989238a02a
Partial-bug: #1774052

commit_message:
Fix share-service VM restart problem

The /etc/mtab file may have mount information such as 'nfsd'
that if copied to /etc/fstab will cause the share server to
hang when rebooted.

Update /etc/fstab with exactly the newly mounted or unmounted
shares rather than simply overwriting /etc/fstab with /etc/mtab.

Change-Id: I67602bae1f928769d768008deca7bd0f2fef1ac2
Close-Bug: #1639662
(cherry picked from commit b76934770b0f42950cad35a3e2a5a8e060462332)

Users of Ironic virt driver want to be able to configure a RAID on
boot of a new instance. As Ironic is currently an admin-only API, it
should be possible to provide a RAID configuration via OpenStack
Compute API to be used by Ironic (or, possibly in the future,

APIImpact

Change-Id: I25de6e794b1f0046c350f499699da305ce9468a4
'}]
commit_message:
Ironic: add support for instance RAID configuration

Users of Ironic virt driver want to be able to configure a RAID on
boot of a new instance. As Ironic is currently an admin-only API, it
should be possible to provide a RAID configuration via OpenStack
Compute API to be used by Ironic (or, possibly in the future,
any other) virt driver.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I25de6e794b1f0046c350f499699da305ce9468a4

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 16:46:19.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I47def751d6718e167ace9dd4169b8a4a87052a9a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I47def751d6718e167ace9dd4169b8a4a87052a9a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Support relay RP for allocation candidates

When the compute node resource provider has no requested resource
itself and can provide them with combination of multiple sharing
resource providers, AllocationCandidates.get_by_filters didn't
return the combination if the sharing providers are in different
aggregations associated to the compute node.

To fix the bug, this patch changes _alloc_candidates_with_shared()
function to build allocation request from non-sharing provider
regardress of whether it has requested resources for its own or
not.

Change-Id: I332fa33c320a697136d6f0994fbad573a31eda1b
Partial-Bug: #1732731

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-07 15:45:32.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'update constraint for oslo.utils to new release 3.28.3

add stestr to upper-constraints.txt and global-requirements.txt

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563394/ brought in os-testr-1.0.0
os-testr brought in stestr, which is unconstrained in pike
this causes installs of os-testr-1.0.0 to install stestr-1.3.0 (latest)
stestr-1.3.0 is not co-installable on pike, it needs python-subunit>=1.3.0
python-subunit is constrained to 1.2.0 on pike.

commit_message:
update constraint for oslo.utils to new release 3.28.3

add stestr to upper-constraints.txt and global-requirements.txt

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563394/ brought in os-testr-1.0.0
os-testr brought in stestr, which is unconstrained in pike
this causes installs of os-testr-1.0.0 to install stestr-1.3.0 (latest)
stestr-1.3.0 is not co-installable on pike, it needs python-subunit>=1.3.0
python-subunit is constrained to 1.2.0 on pike.

Change-Id: Ia37d4230d18d396692f66925e754fb87ec0eb21b

subject: fix pep8 errors under python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:24:30.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/openstack/restore.py', 'freezer/main.py'], 'message': "fix pep8 errors under python 3

Under python 3 'print' is a function, and the linter does not like
having a space between the function name and the paren indicating the
call. Remove the space.

The builtin 'file' is removed under python 3. Replace its use with
'open', which is available on both python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ib8522d8ab1974a4ba3e407ffbe449e2f5fc9471a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
fix pep8 errors under python 3

Under python 3 'print' is a function, and the linter does not like
having a space between the function name and the paren indicating the
call. Remove the space.

The builtin 'file' is removed under python 3. Replace its use with
'open', which is available on both python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ib8522d8ab1974a4ba3e407ffbe449e2f5fc9471a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add retry logic to post_lifecycle_hook_message

This patch adds retry logic to post_lifecycle_hook_message
when posting a lifecyle hook to Zaqar. This will make posting
messages to Zaqar more robust in the event Zaqar is unavailable.

Change-Id: I1681cf44a4c0a8bded21d328b9a7fff611355529

subject: Added engine_name parameter to action creation.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-22 08:45:31.000000000', 'files': ['disaster_recovery/actions/workflows/action.py'], 'message': "Added engine_name parameter to action creation.

With implementation of new engines (nova, rsync, ...) a regression was
introduced - user is no longer able to create working action for nova instance
backup because config generated by freezer-scheduler passed to freezer-agent
doesn't contain 'engine_name' thus falling back to default value 'tar'
even when 'mode' is set to 'nova'. This patch adds possibility to specify
'engine_name' in web UI which is then passed to freezer-scheduler job cfg.

Change-Id: Ifc4ed728db369da54fecef3c2ecf4dfcbfe4fefb
"}]
commit_message:
Added engine_name parameter to action creation.

With implementation of new engines (nova, rsync, ...) a regression was
introduced - user is no longer able to create working action for nova instance
backup because config generated by freezer-scheduler passed to freezer-agent
doesn't contain 'engine_name' thus falling back to default value 'tar'
even when 'mode' is set to 'nova'. This patch adds possibility to specify
'engine_name' in web UI which is then passed to freezer-scheduler job cfg.

Change-Id: Ifc4ed728db369da54fecef3c2ecf4dfcbfe4fefb

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-03 19:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['tools/configure_for_func_testing.sh', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/base.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ip_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/namespaces.py', 'neutron/tests/fullstack/test_connectivity.py'], 'message': 'Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

Change-Id: Ia6b772e91c1f94612ca29d7082eca999372e60d6
(cherry picked from commit 3e9e2a5b4b2654864bb0e2a7d9b841eb03240147)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable IPv6 forwarding by default on HA routers

In case of HA routers IPv6 forwarding is not disabled by default and
then enabled only on master node.
Before this patch it was done in opposite way, so forwarding was
enabled by default and then disabled on backup nodes.
When forwarding was enabled/disabled for qg- port, MLDv2 packets are
sent and that might lead to temportary packets loss as packets to
FIP were sent to this backup node instead of master one.

Related-Bug: #1771841

Change-Id: Ia6b772e91c1f94612ca29d7082eca999372e60d6
(cherry picked from commit 3e9e2a5b4b2654864bb0e2a7d9b841eb03240147)

blueprint enhanced-kvm-storage-qos

QEMU 1.7 provides options to specify maximum burst IOPS and maximum burst
bandwidth per disk. Additionally disk IO size can be specified as part of
this version of QEMU.

At the moment, the Nova libvirt driver does not support setting storage
burst IOPS limits. For this reason, some instances might exhaust
storage resources, impacting other tenants and applications.

Change-Id: Ic51231e3c0d5d01f479d1ca630abdfcd74ce6a07
'}]
commit_message:
Enhanced KVM Storage QoS

blueprint enhanced-kvm-storage-qos

QEMU 1.7 provides options to specify maximum burst IOPS and maximum burst
bandwidth per disk. Additionally disk IO size can be specified as part of
this version of QEMU.

At the moment, the Nova libvirt driver does not support setting storage
burst IOPS limits. For this reason, some instances might exhaust
storage resources, impacting other tenants and applications.

Change-Id: Ic51231e3c0d5d01f479d1ca630abdfcd74ce6a07

subject: WIP repurpose action container_images_prepare
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-05-07 20:42:18.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/plan_management.yaml', 'tripleo_common/constants.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/container_images.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/actions/test_container_images.py'], 'message': 'WIP repurpose action container_images_prepare

Previously this action wrote an environment to the plan which
populates all image parameters with default values.

This commit changes that behaviour so that it now writes environment
files which populate the ContainerImagePrepare parameter, one file for
pulling from the default registry, and one file for uploading/pulling
from the undercloud registry.

This is marked as WIP as this will be the last change which triggers
the switchover to workflow-driven prepare by default.

Change-Id: I53f441b46474efcd80f8ee5f2e212c71982df400
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow
'}]
commit_message:
WIP repurpose action container_images_prepare

Previously this action wrote an environment to the plan which
populates all image parameters with default values.

This commit changes that behaviour so that it now writes environment
files which populate the ContainerImagePrepare parameter, one file for
pulling from the default registry, and one file for uploading/pulling
from the undercloud registry.

This is marked as WIP as this will be the last change which triggers
the switchover to workflow-driven prepare by default.

Change-Id: I53f441b46474efcd80f8ee5f2e212c71982df400
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
convert windows line endings to unix format

Under python 3 the linter does not like line endings with \r\n so
replace them with just \n.

Change-Id: I6728ee3fc39a5b22ca06fcd9055872271ab79a53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-06 13:40:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': '[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829
'}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Wait for SG to be applied by L2 agent

In fullstack test_securitygroup there were used simple
net_helpers.assert_ping() and assert_not_ping() functions
which tries to ping IP address 3 times with some short timeout
and test fails if result of ping will not be as expected.

Unfortunately sometimes in fullstack tests it might be not enough
if test is creating new SG or SG rule or apply SG to port and
just after that checks connection because L2 agent don't have
enough time to apply all rules on "host".
This patch changes it to use block_until_ping() and
block_until_no_ping() methods from FakeMachine fixture.
It will also check if ping is possible/not possible but
will try to check it for 1 minute before fails.

Similar change is also done for methods which checks TCP
connectivity using netcat helper class. It now uses
common_utils.wait_until_true() helper function instead of
fail immediatelly.

Change-Id: I9e523d803e3c49d5d090ae5b9d36d43ce7311535
Closes-Bug: #1774006
Closes-Bug: #1767829

commit_message:
Move kata-run to this repo

We rename the job to kata-runsh to satisify the unique job name
constraint. This allows the job to be self testing with a depends on on
the github side PRs.

Change-Id: I7b0722c120c1e0a1f6315e75f739fa29baab1738

subject: Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 15993, 'name': 'Amy Marrich', 'display_name': 'Amy Marrich (spotz)', 'email': 'amy@demarco.com', 'username': 'amarrich'}, {'_account_id': 16198, 'name': 'Ilya Popov', 'email': 'hebulrih@gmail.com', 'username': 'IPO'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 21486, 'name': 'wangqi', 'email': 'wang.qi@99cloud.net', 'username': 'wangqi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23871, 'name': 'MargaritaShakhova', 'email': 'shakhova.margarita@gmail.com', 'username': 'MargaritaShakhova'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 07:47:29.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8c7b78424f699f19ea0a11e4c9dfee78cee1976f)
"}]
commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8c7b78424f699f19ea0a11e4c9dfee78cee1976f)

Starting in Rocky, nova is removing the deprecated
nova-network specific APIs and they will return a 410
response on any microversion.

commit_message:
Configure tempest [compute-feature-enabled]/nova_network=False

Starting in Rocky, nova is removing the deprecated
nova-network specific APIs and they will return a 410
response on any microversion.

This change configures Tempest to not run tests against
those nova-network specific APIs.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571556/

Part of nova blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I7a21eacdb554d1d8339d773dba464eb9cd110e90

commit_message:
Release OpenStack-Ansible Milestone2

This releases Milestone 2.

OpenStack-Ansible is now releasing only its "integrated repo"
as part of deliverables, and not with the full list of
repositories anymore, according to the reasons
explained here [1].

[1]: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131149.html

Change-Id: I64e554f4c20ae90c40c1df0a44b68472aba763c4

subject: Add kata-run job to kata-containers/proxy
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-06-07 19:29:44.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/kata-run/run.yaml', 'nodepool/nl03.openstack.org.yaml', 'tools/zuul-projects-checks.py', 'zuul.d/projects.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml', 'playbooks/kata-run/pre.yaml'], 'message': "Add kata-run job to kata-containers/proxy

This is likely to not work yet, but since we aren't gating on
kata-containers/proxy we won't import job config from that repo which
would make these changes self testing. In order to get the ball moving
we need to start somewhere so start here.

This adds a vexxhost specific bionic image which we will start with
until the nodepool azure driver is tested and deployed. We should be
able to make progress on adding jobs and getting the driver going in
parallel this way.

Change-Id: Ia56c2cb3046e31e50014c8bf24342cceacb7db8a
"}]
commit_message:
Add kata-run job to kata-containers/proxy

This is likely to not work yet, but since we aren't gating on
kata-containers/proxy we won't import job config from that repo which
would make these changes self testing. In order to get the ball moving
we need to start somewhere so start here.

This adds a vexxhost specific bionic image which we will start with
until the nodepool azure driver is tested and deployed. We should be
able to make progress on adding jobs and getting the driver going in
parallel this way.

Change-Id: Ia56c2cb3046e31e50014c8bf24342cceacb7db8a

subject: use only exceptions for uri validations
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:11:23.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/location.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/vmware_datastore.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/rbd.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/sheepdog.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/cinder.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'glance_store/tests/unit/test_location.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/filesystem.py', 'glance_store/_drivers/http.py'], 'message': 'use only exceptions for uri validations

Currently we use asserts for uri validation, which is not good
practice because assert will be deleted from optimized code.
We must use exceptions in such cases.

Co-authored-by: kairat_kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I89c5f1b74be89c759d5754d6cab54dc86c946be1
'}]
commit_message:
use only exceptions for uri validations

Currently we use asserts for uri validation, which is not good
practice because assert will be deleted from optimized code.
We must use exceptions in such cases.

Co-authored-by: kairat_kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I89c5f1b74be89c759d5754d6cab54dc86c946be1

commit_message:
Add --export option to environment-get

Use --export to give output suitable for importing via
environment-update. The other 'get-definition' commands will be
deprecated in favor of a --export option to 'get' and 'show'

Change-Id: I1bf9b621b498b6978d6fa5903db58c1474b31c93
Closes-Bug: #1769491

commit_message:
Remove deprecated ansible driver options

these are ansible_deploy_username and ansible_deploy_key_file.
Operators will have to set ansible_username and ansible_key_file
node drover_info fields instead.

Change-Id: I12a65aed63e4d1889f403ed8cdff1489ff762628

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 16:24:23.000000000', 'files': ['common-tasks/test-force-package-cache-update.yml', 'test-ansible-functional.sh'], 'message': 'Improve idempotency

These discovery tasks always show up as "changed" in the Ansible
output. This patch ensures that they are not labeled as changed
when they are run.

The patch also fixes the idempotency check grep so that it works
properly with multiple hosts. Previously, if *any* of the hosts
finished with no changes/failures, the entire job was marked as
passing the idempotency tests.

Depends-On: I17748b0dd2307fd9bee705140c67883140090298
Change-Id: Ie414d32d39fdeeedd77fe94b57a09ba344084ec1
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>

'}]
commit_message:
Improve idempotency

These discovery tasks always show up as "changed" in the Ansible
output. This patch ensures that they are not labeled as changed
when they are run.

The patch also fixes the idempotency check grep so that it works
properly with multiple hosts. Previously, if *any* of the hosts
finished with no changes/failures, the entire job was marked as
passing the idempotency tests.

Depends-On: I17748b0dd2307fd9bee705140c67883140090298
Change-Id: Ie414d32d39fdeeedd77fe94b57a09ba344084ec1
Signed-off-by: Major Hayden <major@mhtx.net>
(cherry picked from commit 391a951f70381246bddfa677e08aaad221e086e3)

commit_message:
Don't restart ivs/nfvswitch in os-net-config

Restarting ivs during ugrades causes network disruptions. Removing both
the ivs and nvfswitch restarts as they are not required.

Change-Id: I3d26cbc8484c72d6bfc133c59c8fc065add226c9
Closes-Bug: 1757130
(cherry picked from commit db081a75c5d2b7a99b4b796f9de7a4aadd7ab522)
(cherry picked from commit 08a0f081bf627ef09b934b2cc1dc66e172a1dbd4)

commit_message:
Add validation to avoid the upgrade if the Overcloud stack name has underscores.

We need to ensure the Overcloud is fixed before proceeding with an Upgrade.

Fix only for stable/newton
Resolves: rhbz#1576839
Change-Id: I203d1b4bee19d24e0cadd52d66556f3e6af68528
Closes-Bug: 1775404

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix export path used as volume name

On ONTAP NFS driver, the export path was being used as the volume
name. If the export path is different than the volume name, the
API call to delete files would fail and the driver would invoke
a fallback method that deletes the files manually. This patch fixes
that by finding the correct volume name.

(cherry-picked from commit dbca62c207d63bbc192acf75ae39c6b56702295a)
Change-Id: Ice78889573a36ff5e8873a0d316ddcf180d0263f
Closes-bug: #1690954

Some flows may be missing in OVS (on a per table basis) when deploying

this patch implements a workaround. The workaround is to check if all
the tables exist on each OVS node. If they are missing, then reset the

commit_message:
Adds check and resyncs ODL/OVS OF pipeline

Some flows may be missing in OVS (on a per table basis) when deploying
with OpenDaylight. There is no OpenDaylight fix yet for this issue, so
this patch implements a workaround. The workaround is to check if all
the tables exist on each OVS node. If they are missing, then reset the
OpenFlow connection to the ODL controller, which will result in ODL
pushing the flows again and inserting the missing flows.

Closes-Bug: 1775436

Change-Id: I28d13a26198268cfd1f3e9e64236605f24319a04
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

"}]
commit_message:
Switch to specific flavor and slowly bump capacity

We've got new capacity to donate to the OpenStack infrastructure,
this also includes a flavor that includes disk by default to avoid
any issues with boot-from-volume.

We'll be bumping this number up soon but just wanted to test things
out and make sure nothing crash-and-burns.

Change-Id: I60f288cda65b808c2612beb1efb03919c075de98

commit_message:
Hide old images from default image-list

The spec looks how operators can have more control over images
that are included in the default image list. This is achieved
with a new property 'hidden' to omit images from the users.

Change-Id: I7bba164c350e74f9d3490c77d536bffdc1ccc075

subject: Fix: Router port always marked as DOWN
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 13:56:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstackgaterc', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix: Router port always marked as DOWN

Router ports in OVN is never bound to a host given their decentralized
nature. For that reason, the code in Neutron core that change the status
of the ports (router ports are normal ports underneath) was ignoring the
OVN router ports.

This patch is forcing the status of those router ports to ACTIVE in
networking-ovn. A comment was left in the code in case we want to change
the core Neutron approach in the future.

This patch is also enabling two tempest tests that checks for this
router port status which were disabled before.

Change-Id: I5fd18e6e395a783e9591c058b80b63d42b24a3df
Closes-Bug: #1715126
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Router port always marked as DOWN

Router ports in OVN is never bound to a host given their decentralized
nature. For that reason, the code in Neutron core that change the status
of the ports (router ports are normal ports underneath) was ignoring the
OVN router ports.

This patch is forcing the status of those router ports to ACTIVE in
networking-ovn. A comment was left in the code in case we want to change
the core Neutron approach in the future.

This patch is also enabling two tempest tests that checks for this
router port status which were disabled before.

Change-Id: I5fd18e6e395a783e9591c058b80b63d42b24a3df
Closes-Bug: #1715126

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-07 11:32:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I03574b12fc9ef07ce459e81c9b8219a3b10bd4da
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I959afa8a75f09f5fc212424defa4865816f3ab1b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6c11da63a69121680db525ffdd350cfdde89b1f8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Namespace deletion functionality for namespace_subnet driver

This patch extends the namespace_subnet driver to handle namespace
deletion. It ensures the created resources during namespace creation
are removed upon namespace deletion.

Note it does not currently support deleting the extra ports created
by the ports pool feature, so it should not be used if ports pool
feature is enabled. A follow up patch will address this issue

Partially Implements: blueprint network-namespace

Change-Id: I2eed278dafacd5090a902bacfd366f7cdf9edca4

commit_message:
Add afsmon project

This is an import of some code I developed for proof-of concept to
send AFS statistic to statsd.  It is currently working in a manual
fashion (see some details on the stats in
I8066f05df0c8eb2f4e211beaa25bccbd0261ca9b) so I think this fits best
in openstack-infra before it gets puppeted for automatic deployment.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/572527
Change-Id: Ie7c491acf4ff734964be73487dc230478adfa96f

commit_message:
Remove the deprecated config option

The option 'allow_inuse_volume_type_modification' is
introduced as a bridge to not break upgrades without
notice. It is introduced in Ocata release [1], so it
is time to remove this option.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/440680/

Change-Id: I8c61b11994c1f8f571e65cefe4965f7d69b13100

subject: Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 11:39:48.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh'], 'message': 'Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

On master and stable/queens tox_install.sh is not used anymore, this is
why stable/pike is the first version to be fixed.

Change-Id: Ic714e919542bd64194ba0d73910508d335719b68
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

On master and stable/queens tox_install.sh is not used anymore, this is
why stable/pike is the first version to be fixed.

Change-Id: Ic714e919542bd64194ba0d73910508d335719b68

subject: Convert puppet-openstackci jobs to zuulv3
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:35:58.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/infra-puppet-beaker-rspec/run.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/openstackci-beaker-centos-7/run.yaml', 'zuul.d/zuul-legacy-jobs.yaml', 'zuul.d/project-templates.yaml', 'zuul.d/zuul-legacy-project-templates.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/openstackci-beaker-ubuntu-trusty/run.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/openstackci-beaker/run.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Convert puppet-openstackci jobs to zuulv3

This patch moves the puppet-openstackci beaker jobs out of legacy. Since
this job is essentially the same as the regular beaker jobs, we don't
need new playbooks, we just need to adjust the beaker-rspec playbooks to
run the puppet-openstackci tests.

Since this was the last legacy job in the infra-puppet-apply-jobs
template, move it out of the legacy templates to the regular templates.

This doesn't remove the legacy-puppet-openstackci-beaker-rspec jobs
or their parent legacy-openstackci-base since those are still defined in
project-config.

Change-Id: I7f7cb133fc41eba07da224291b7f2d0659b0deb6
"}]
commit_message:
Convert puppet-openstackci jobs to zuulv3

This patch moves the puppet-openstackci beaker jobs out of legacy. Since
this job is essentially the same as the regular beaker jobs, we don't
need new playbooks, we just need to adjust the beaker-rspec playbooks to
run the puppet-openstackci tests.

Since this was the last legacy job in the infra-puppet-apply-jobs
template, move it out of the legacy templates to the regular templates.

This doesn't remove the legacy-puppet-openstackci-beaker-rspec jobs
or their parent legacy-openstackci-base since those are still defined in
project-config.

Change-Id: I7f7cb133fc41eba07da224291b7f2d0659b0deb6

commit_message:
Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches due to the new
pip version 10 introduces some previously Warning as Error: in case of
calling "pip install" without any package name, the command fails.
tox_install.sh is called during docs job without any package passed to
pip.

On master and stable/queens tox_install.sh is not used anymore, this is
why stable/pike is the first version to be fixed.

Change-Id: I8155fb720c35086ed3719fd282b8944627129f14

Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

Change-Id: I4c20eb58982c66598f0283864b9863b84cc29e57

subject: Convert infra's beaker jobs for zuulv3
revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:01:48.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/infra-puppet-beaker-rspec/run.yaml', 'zuul.d/zuul-legacy-jobs.yaml', 'zuul.d/project-templates.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/puppet-beaker-rspec/run.yaml', 'zuul.d/zuul-legacy-project-templates.yaml', 'playbooks/legacy/puppet-beaker-rspec/post.yaml', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': "Convert infra's beaker jobs for zuulv3

This patch moves the legacy beaker jobs that were being used for Infra's
puppet modules out of the legecy definitions and into the regular list.

Historically, the test scripts were shared between the Infra and Puppet
OpenStack teams, but the Puppet OpenStack team has already moved their
jobs in-repo so we can remove tasks specific to their setup.

We need to leave some jobs and playbooks in place that are still being
used by the puppet-midonet project which belongs to neither team.

Change-Id: Iefea6ee173cff2bf050d99d96ae2e1d1a51b7f49
"}]
commit_message:
Convert infra's beaker jobs for zuulv3

This patch moves the legacy beaker jobs that were being used for Infra's
puppet modules out of the legecy definitions and into the regular list.

Historically, the test scripts were shared between the Infra and Puppet
OpenStack teams, but the Puppet OpenStack team has already moved their
jobs in-repo so we can remove tasks specific to their setup.

We need to leave some jobs and playbooks in place that are still being
used by the puppet-midonet project which belongs to neither team.

Change-Id: Iefea6ee173cff2bf050d99d96ae2e1d1a51b7f49

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-07 07:45:02.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/swift-storage.yaml'], 'message': "Add sanity checks for xinetd service restart.

xinetd.service is not installed on pre-provisioned nodes,
 so we'll add extra check for its restart.

(cherry picked from commit 302af5066ec93c82bd884fdb141a28b4f69ac6dc)

commit_message:
Add sanity checks for xinetd service restart.

xinetd.service is not installed on pre-provisioned nodes,
 so we'll add extra check for its restart.

(cherry picked from commit 302af5066ec93c82bd884fdb141a28b4f69ac6dc)
Change-Id: I4fbac81ceb4aba534395cf8c0a842fb732559234
Closes-Bug: 1775154

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-06-06 00:40:02.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/elang-version-2c1135466ef94032.yaml', 'tests/ansible-role-requirements.yml', 'tasks/install_yum.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'tasks/install_apt.yml', 'tests/rabbitmq_server-upgrade-overrides.yml', 'tox.ini', 'defaults/main.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3edccb24a3f714be8fcc32851342363e44f7ea2f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Stop installing percona-release and setup using yum_repository
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-07 13:04:14.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_install_yum.yml', 'vars/redhat-7.yml'], 'message': "Stop installing percona-release and setup using yum_repository

Due to the security role adding the `localpkg_gpgcheck` option and
the fact that the Percona release RPM is not signed, it fails to
install leading to failing gate for CentOS.

The behaviour for Debian-based operating systems is to manually
install the repositories so let's switch CentOS to do the same.

Change-Id: I71840bd209cd398e0ce46d61ac895dea68ba193c
Related-Bug: #1675918
"}]
commit_message:
Stop installing percona-release and setup using yum_repository

Due to the security role adding the `localpkg_gpgcheck` option and
the fact that the Percona release RPM is not signed, it fails to
install leading to failing gate for CentOS.

The behaviour for Debian-based operating systems is to manually
install the repositories so let's switch CentOS to do the same.

Change-Id: I71840bd209cd398e0ce46d61ac895dea68ba193c
Related-Bug: #1675918

commit_message:
Handle Null check for STD_ATTR_MAP:

e.g. when running individual UTs, STD_ATTR_MAP fails with keyerror

python -m testtools.run networking_ovn.tests.unit.test_ovn_db_sync.TestOvnSbSyncML2.test_ovn_sb_sync
module = __import__(module_name)
File "networking_ovn/tests/unit/test_ovn_db_sync.py", line 18, in <module>
from networking_ovn.common import ovn_client
File "networking_ovn/common/ovn_client.py", line 41, in <module>
from networking_ovn.db import revision as db_rev
File "networking_ovn/db/revision.py", line 33, in <module>
STD_ATTR_MAP[ovn_const.TYPE_ROUTER_PORTS] = STD_ATTR_MAP[ovn_const.TYPE_PORTS]
KeyError: 'ports'

Hence, this commit fixes the same.

Change-Id: Ie117b69f21c6b247fa52915a8d10902ced634bb5

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
devstack: fix octavia allocation ranges

According to the documentation, we should reserve the latter half of the
service subnet cidr so that we don't let octavia vrrp allocate IPs that
can be used by Kubernetes/OpenShift own service IPAM

Closes-Bug: #1763278
Change-Id: Ib4d176ba92cb42cdd6f8105e15843c7e967175cf
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

subject: tell flake8 to ignore unicode
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:15:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/exceptions/__init__.py'], 'message': "tell flake8 to ignore unicode

There is no builtin type 'unicode' under python 3. The code is already
doing the correct thing at runtime, but that check is not evaluated
when the linter runs under python 3 so it fails because the name is
not defined. This change tells the linter to ignore the line in the
exceptions package.

Change-Id: Idea04659d3699ab2243f6c325d13d43abe9b447a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tell flake8 to ignore unicode

There is no builtin type 'unicode' under python 3. The code is already
doing the correct thing at runtime, but that check is not evaluated
when the linter runs under python 3 so it fails because the name is
not defined. This change tells the linter to ignore the line in the
exceptions package.

Change-Id: Idea04659d3699ab2243f6c325d13d43abe9b447a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Remove direct tagging/branching for yaql
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 09:39:44.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/yaql.config'], 'message': "Remove direct tagging/branching for yaql

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. The yaql library is associated with
the Murano team, which follows that process already. Let's fix the
ACLs to remove direct tagging/branching for yaql as well.

Change-Id: I98f438ebfa521bd59e3f607e99d73e2ab0777b91
"}]
commit_message:
Remove direct tagging/branching for yaql

The release process for official OpenStack components now uses
release requests using changes proposed to the openstack/releases
git repository. This allows peer review of release requests,
including version numbers, and run a series of checks to make
sure the release is likely to be successful once the tag is
pushed. The same process supports the creation of additional repo
branches as well. This all ensures that releases are reported
correctly on the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags directly
or create branches directly. The yaql library is associated with
the Murano team, which follows that process already. Let's fix the
ACLs to remove direct tagging/branching for yaql as well.

Change-Id: I98f438ebfa521bd59e3f607e99d73e2ab0777b91

need them when we install packages straight from the distro repos.

commit_message:
Fix build error due to doc warning and l-c

Warning generated due to title line being too short. With warnings
now being treated as errors, this causes docs builds to fail.

Lower-constraints also out of sync with actual versions used in
requirements files causing requirements validation errors too.

Due to Zuul job changes, need both changes together to get things
to pass.

Change-Id: I769c679389cb0985b53561105c5244637502b226

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id88b2b77ae225a88238331ca245a0fc90a742039
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id88b2b77ae225a88238331ca245a0fc90a742039
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If3aad2663d76fce58430d3b6ee6220ff550977a3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2018-06-06 22:34:39.000000000', 'files': ['qinling/orchestrator/kubernetes/manager.py', 'qinling/engine/default_engine.py', 'runtimes/python2/Dockerfile', 'qinling/tests/unit/engine/test_default_engine.py', 'qinling/orchestrator/kubernetes/templates/deployment.j2', 'devstack/settings', 'qinling/engine/utils.py', 'runtimes/python2/requirements.txt', 'runtimes/python2/server.py', 'qinling/tests/unit/orchestrator/kubernetes/test_manager.py', 'runtimes/python2/cglimit.py', 'qinling_tempest_plugin/config.py', 'runtimes/python2/custom-entrypoint.sh'], 'message': "Runtime implementation for non-image type function.

Using 'cgroup' in runtime server to limit cpu and memory resources.

Each pod in deployment will has respective 'cgroup' directory on host.
Under '/sys/fs/cgroup/xx/kubepods/<qos_class>/pod<uid>' directory, use
HOSTNAME to create a new cgroup folder, which will only be used to
limit function execution. Then we do not need to care about how and
when to delete this new folder on host.

Use 'openstackqinling/python-runtime:0.0.3' as the new python runtime
image.

Story: 2001586
Task: 14415
Change-Id: Id04a72c4f4a3c559dc7c746688b13ef93656d125
"}]
commit_message:
Runtime implementation for non-image type function.

Using 'cgroup' in runtime server to limit cpu and memory resources.

Each pod in deployment will has respective 'cgroup' directory on host.
Under '/sys/fs/cgroup/xx/kubepods/<qos_class>/pod<uid>' directory, use
HOSTNAME to create a new cgroup folder, which will only be used to
limit function execution. Then we do not need to care about how and
when to delete this new folder on host.

Use 'openstackqinling/python-runtime:0.0.3' as the new python runtime
image.

Story: 2001586
Task: 14415
Change-Id: Id04a72c4f4a3c559dc7c746688b13ef93656d125

commit_message:
Allow Kolla Ceph to deploy bluestore OSDs in Kolla

Support Kolla Ceph to deploy blustore OSDs. With the patch, Kolla
Ceph can deploy bluestore OSDs on ONE, TWO or THREE storage
devices.

Before deploy bluestore OSD, please prepare devices. The detailed
Please refer to [1] for devices initialization.

extend_start.sh: initialize and start bluestore OSD

find_disk.py: search the devices for bluestore OSD

[1]: specs/kolla-ceph-bluestore.rst

Partially-Implements: blueprint kolla-ceph-bluestore

Change-Id: I832f490de63e1aeb68814697cda610a51b622c1f

commit_message:
Switch containerized job to Octavia

As our default LB choice is Octavia, this commit moves containerized
LBaaS v2 job to exeprimental queue and promotes containerized Octavia
job to check and gate queues.

commit_message:
Redirect the old baremetal install-guide for master to its current location

People seem to find /project-install-guide/baremetal/draft pretty often,
and assume that it's the up-to-date installation docs for ironic, while
in reality it is frozen at some point around Pike. Let us redirect
to the actual master installation docs.

Change-Id: I32b5fc3e0d6e18c5804b80b8bc2d6d976a689ba8

On other platform like aarch64 osprofiler can

Change-Id: I68fe7a33e11d28684962fc5d0b3d326e90784d78

commit_message:
osprofiler support redis

Currently osprofiler only choose elasticsearch,
which is only supported on x86.
On other platform like aarch64 osprofiler can
not be used since no elasticsearch package.

Enable osprofiler by enable_osprofiler: "yes",
which choose elasticsearch by default.
Choose redis by enable_redis: "yes" & osprofiler_backend: "redis"
On platform without elasticsearch support like aarch64
set enable_elasticsearch: "no"

Change-Id: I68fe7a33e11d28684962fc5d0b3d326e90784d78

In the event you have different disks in nodes assigned to each role
you may need to pass role specific parameters, e.g like:

    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/vdc
  OpenShiftWorkerParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/vdd

To enable that we create an inventory file per role, and pass the directory

Change-Id: I8b4d8698405ffb004b081e1f097f300216edfa77
'}]
commit_message:
Decouple OpenShiftGlusterDisks from openshift-master.yaml

In the event you have different disks in nodes assigned to each role
you may need to pass role specific parameters, e.g like:

parameter_defaults:
  OpenShiftMasterParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/vdc
  OpenShiftWorkerParameters:
    OpenShiftGlusterDisks:
      - /dev/vdd

To enable that we create an inventory file per role, and pass the directory
of files to ansible.

Change-Id: I8b4d8698405ffb004b081e1f097f300216edfa77

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-06 17:39:51.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst', 'cli_setup.py'], 'message': 'Add setup script for kolla-cli / kolla-ansible

Created new cli-setup.py script that automates the previously
manual process to create the directories needed for the kolla-cli
and kolla-ansible.  It also improves on the process by leaving the
globals.yml file in place in /etc/kolla and just creating a link
to the group_vars/__GLOBALS__ so that both the kolla-ansible and
kolla-cli commands will work correctly, rather than having their
functioning being mutually exclusive.  Due to kolla-ansible still
expecting to be run as root for most actions the cli_setup.py
script should also be run via sudo.

Change-Id: I5b59317b2c22d10dd82623a548b64f387b6bc9d3
'}]
commit_message:
Add setup script for kolla-cli / kolla-ansible

Created new cli-setup.py script that automates the previously
manual process to create the directories needed for the kolla-cli
and kolla-ansible.  It also improves on the process by leaving the
globals.yml file in place in /etc/kolla and just creating a link
to the group_vars/__GLOBALS__ so that both the kolla-ansible and
kolla-cli commands will work correctly, rather than having their
functioning being mutually exclusive.  Due to kolla-ansible still
expecting to be run as root for most actions the cli_setup.py
script should also be run via sudo.

Change-Id: I5b59317b2c22d10dd82623a548b64f387b6bc9d3

revisions:

In this tempest job, the mock datasource is used to create an entity
graph with ~20,000 vertices. This job will contain tests for
init procedure, processes, restarts, multiple api calls.

Other data sources are disabled. Heat, Telemetry, Mistral
are not installed.

This commit includes the first two tests, both using a template where
each action causes another action (three levels).
one test restarts vitrage-graph so the init procedure evaluates this template.

Change-Id: I9c4c329983bbe5930de5484fa6932b318746ed5c
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new tempest job with a mock datasource

In this tempest job, the mock datasource is used to create an entity
graph with ~20,000 vertices. This job will contain tests for
init procedure, processes, restarts, multiple api calls.

Other data sources are disabled. Heat, Telemetry, Mistral
are not installed.

This commit includes the first two tests, both using a template where
each action causes another action (three levels).
one test restarts vitrage-graph so the init procedure evaluates this template.
the other test does not restart. result should be the same.

Change-Id: I9c4c329983bbe5930de5484fa6932b318746ed5c

commit_message:
Fix typo in config-download template so it match neturon api

The DeployedServerPortMap need to use keys matching the neutron
api. This change replaces 'subnet' with 'subnets'.

Related-Bug: #1772396
Change-Id: I8fdc7e711972e7ac488216db35409058c2c9cbcc

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6b107fce3daa8292b5fe6b5730a03008bf8987f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6b107fce3daa8292b5fe6b5730a03008bf8987f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iba35cef6449b9c40a820114d59c1c45f56946b8d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9a8f7b1734b23751e47297a15676219627969d7c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Using oslo.policy for monasca-api

Added policies and used policy enforcement engine
from monasca-common.

- Replaced security with oslo.policy
- Updated unit tests and implemented some new tests
- Added a new entry point for generating sample policy file by tox

story: 2001233
task: 6355

Change-Id: I4aa444fe6ec883160c03c201145c77994b6615f9
Signed-off-by: Amir Mofakhar <amofakhar@op5.com>

commit_message:
Pin cmd2 to the last python2 version of the library

The cmd2-0.9.0 is python3-only and the tempest venv is built
unconstrained, so it's trying to bring in the latest version
which is incompatible with python2. We pin the library to
ensure that the venv build completes correctly.

Depends-On: I35e3688ae632d5f7747f32dafc41d23883c033c5
Change-Id: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8c7b78424f699f19ea0a11e4c9dfee78cee1976f)

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5f2ebf16d2768811f55939a55bedf59b808e0b9e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I5f2ebf16d2768811f55939a55bedf59b808e0b9e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Stop showing passwords when bootstrap script is ran

bootstrapping password.

commit_message:
Add .rst files check to pep8

Errors in README.rst prevent the package from being registered in Pypi. We would like pep8 to fail in these cases.
For more details, see: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131233.html

Change-Id: I8a6c333c4c968054fe8b63bdf844fe8d94ce98b5

commit_message:
Refactor exception handling in cmd.api

Replace the known exception tuple with a map of exception classes
to error codes to preserve backward compatibility of exit codes.
Also change the code to handle unknown members of the Exception
hierarchy without breaking.

Co-authored-by: jiangpch <jiangpengcheng@navercorp.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1726213

Change-Id: Iabfc2ded45a576a18bdb30a6c3ada8b9799a3196

commit_message:
Updating time for functional tests

Currenlty, some gates is being failed with logs like this

"""
b'Response: {"description": "Provided object does not match schema
\'Secret\': \'expiration\' is before current time.
Invalid property: \'expiration\'", "title": "Bad Request", "code": 400}'
"""

So it is necessary to update the time to create secrets successfully.

Change-Id: I4f2d3817d9a2380919d16e76ef5dcba3ec62e5a1

subject: Dockerfile to run unit tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-29 08:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Dockerfile to run unit tests

Docker containers are very useful for developers because they are
lighter than VMs and permits to have snapshots of each image, allowing
the developer to quickly check changes between different commits and to
have a clean environment to test their changes. Also, they can be used
in the CI system, freeing up resources.

This Dockerfile permits to create a container with all the requirements
needed to run the unit tests, you have to follow the next steps (ipv6 has to
be enabled in your docker daemon [1]):

1. Build the docker image to run your unit tests (it only depends on the
test-requirements.txt file):

    docker build -t neutron-dev:23sdf .

2. Run your container to set up your test environment mounting your
local folder so you can have access to the artifacts outside of the
container:

docker run -itv $(pwd):/neutron --privileged --sysctl \
    net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=0  neutron:23sdf bash

3. Run the unit tests inside the container:

cd /neutron
tox -e py27

[1] https://docs.docker.com/config/daemon/ipv6/

Related-Bug: #1773818

Change-Id: I5973c8772d3ca530f9e30710759425adc18994d2
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Dockerfile to run unit tests

Docker containers are very useful for developers because they are
lighter than VMs and permits to have snapshots of each image, allowing
the developer to quickly check changes between different commits and to
have a clean environment to test their changes. Also, they can be used
in the CI system, freeing up resources.

This Dockerfile permits to create a container with all the requirements
needed to run the unit tests, you have to follow the next steps (ipv6 has to
be enabled in your docker daemon [1]):

1. Build the docker image to run your unit tests (it only depends on the
test-requirements.txt file):

    docker build -t neutron-dev:23sdf .

2. Run your container to set up your test environment mounting your
local folder so you can have access to the artifacts outside of the
container:

docker run -itv $(pwd):/neutron --privileged --sysctl \
    net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6=0  neutron:23sdf bash

3. Run the unit tests inside the container:

cd /neutron
tox -e py27

[1] https://docs.docker.com/config/daemon/ipv6/

Related-Bug: #1773818

Change-Id: I5973c8772d3ca530f9e30710759425adc18994d2
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>

commit_message:
WIP Hierarchical approach for helm charts

This PS introduce an alternative approach in storing helm chart. The top
of hierarchy is kolla-kubernetes, with childs as main openstack services
and sub-childs as microservices. This approach allows to keep global
variables at parent level, service specific variables at service level
and sub-child variable at corresponding sub-child level. with HELM 2.1
we will be able to deploy a single microservice but with all variables
defined at parent and child levels, which makes it very flexible.

Change-Id: I5739dea54a888eb660dd44d0f496a8ec81f1565e
Partially-Implements: blueprint helm-packaging

subject: Neutron create mariadb failed with wrong login host
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-06 10:55:16.000000000', 'files': ['services/neutron/neutron-bootstrap-job-create-db.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Neutron create mariadb failed with wrong login host

Neutron create mariadb bootstrap will using ##neutron_database_address##
variable as mariadb login host. But the default value was defined in
kolla-ansbile neutron's default variable file. It is "{{
kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ database_port }}"

This will cause the login host will be something like "mariadb:3306" It
should be "mariadb" instead of "mariadb:3306" We can just rewrite this
to "mariadb", just like other services (ex: nova or cinder) which how to
create db.

Change-Id: Ib02f3dad80219e13166a58eeb78dee0cabddd8ec
Closed-Bug: 1670318
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron create mariadb failed with wrong login host

Neutron create mariadb bootstrap will using ##neutron_database_address##
variable as mariadb login host. But the default value was defined in
kolla-ansbile neutron's default variable file. It is "{{
kolla_internal_fqdn }}:{{ database_port }}"

This will cause the login host will be something like "mariadb:3306" It
should be "mariadb" instead of "mariadb:3306" We can just rewrite this
to "mariadb", just like other services (ex: nova or cinder) which how to
create db.

Change-Id: Ib02f3dad80219e13166a58eeb78dee0cabddd8ec
Closed-Bug: 1670318

subject: [helm]Create keystone public service failed with nil external vip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-08 08:54:13.000000000', 'files': ['helm/kolla-common/templates/_common_svc.yaml'], 'message': '[helm]Create keystone public service failed with nil external vip

When user try to install keystone-public-svc with default value.
Helm will installed failed with following messages

$ helm install microservice/keystone-public-svc
Created tunnel using local port: '41270'
SERVER: "localhost:41270"
CHART PATH: /home/lyan/helm/microservice/keystone-public-svc
Error: error validating "": error validating data: unexpected nil value
for field spec.externalIPs[0]

Keystone-public-svc will default enable external port, this will cause
svc yaml will need to get externa_vip value. But it will not been assign
any value. Therefore the svc yaml will output:

```
externalIPs:
    -
```

Maybe we should check whether external port had been enable and external vip had been added,
then assign external vip.

Change-Id: If74b97036d451420a2dbfef2786d9015657a47ac
Closed-Bug: 1670979
'}]
commit_message:
[helm]Create keystone public service failed with nil external vip

When user try to install keystone-public-svc with default value.
Helm will installed failed with following messages

$ helm install microservice/keystone-public-svc
Created tunnel using local port: '41270'
SERVER: "localhost:41270"
CHART PATH: /home/lyan/helm/microservice/keystone-public-svc
Error: error validating "": error validating data: unexpected nil value
for field spec.externalIPs[0]

Keystone-public-svc will default enable external port, this will cause
svc yaml will need to get externa_vip value. But it will not been assign
any value. Therefore the svc yaml will output:

```
externalIPs:
    -
```

Maybe we should check whether external port had been enable and external vip had been added,
then assign external vip.

Change-Id: If74b97036d451420a2dbfef2786d9015657a47ac
Closed-Bug: 1670979

Kolla Kubernetes Service Discovery BP

The scope of this BP is to make use of existing dynamic dns
functionality in Kubernetes and to introduce the service naming
convention which should be followed while generating service
configuration files.

subject: Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 14:17:34.000000000', 'files': ['kolla_kubernetes/utils.py'], 'message': "Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig

Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig when cluster name is not
match with current-context

Current code flow will iterator each cluster in kube config, and then
find matched name with current context. The cluster's server could not
been found if cluster name is not match with current context. We should
find match context name instead cluster name, and then using context's
cluster name to find cluster. Finally get the cluster's server

Change-Id: Ia8a5004552e47e2216fe6413e0359a0df59a3d4e
Closed-Bug: 1669788
"}]
commit_message:
Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig

Kube Util could not get api url from kubeconfig when cluster name is not
match with current-context

Current code flow will iterator each cluster in kube config, and then
find matched name with current context. The cluster's server could not
been found if cluster name is not match with current context. We should
find match context name instead cluster name, and then using context's
cluster name to find cluster. Finally get the cluster's server

Change-Id: Ia8a5004552e47e2216fe6413e0359a0df59a3d4e
Closed-Bug: 1669788

commit_message:
Add --debug to all ceph workflows in gate

The ceph workflows lacked a --debug in helm output.  This doesn't
permit the display of the computed helm charts.  This is a
general improvement to the gate for consistency.
