commit_message:
A start at a simplified devtool environment

We have wasted *TWO* months or more of time attempting to integrate
the development environment with the main gate.  Instead of doing
that, lets start small with a set of scripts based upon the
deployment guide which was built based upon learning how the
gate operates.

The intent is to follow this up with a gate specifically for the
development environment workflow.  I know this is far from perfect.
THe idea is for folks to build on this work in an incremental fashion.
As such, I'd ask for a little liency in the review process.

This will ultimatelly integrate with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/457042/

Change-Id: I90671b4894f0024d3b094c8459edf61e1acfe04a
Partially-Implements: blueprint devenv-taketwo

privileges. It breaks virsh commands runing from the host.

subject: Change ordering of PV retrieval
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-31 14:48:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/destroy/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Change ordering of PV retrieval

In some conditions (such as service charts) the PVs are deleted
by the helm delete iteration.  To solve that, capture the list of
PVs after helm delete occurs.  This works for either service charts
or microchart deployments.

Change-Id: Ia7586c4c7b96c100f52ad682d21145fb654c72bd
'}]
commit_message:
Change ordering of PV retrieval

In some conditions (such as service charts) the PVs are deleted
by the helm delete iteration.  To solve that, capture the list of
PVs after helm delete occurs.  This works for either service charts
or microchart deployments.

Change-Id: Ia7586c4c7b96c100f52ad682d21145fb654c72bd

subject: Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-19 14:44:48.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ceph/defaults/main.yml', 'helm/all_values.yaml', 'helm/microservice/test-ceph-osd-pod/templates/test-ceph-osd-pod.yaml'], 'message': "Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

128 MB is default TC size at above jewel version.
and if we don't set this config,
osd daemon will running with 32 MB.
because 32MB is default size in TCmalloc 2.4 version.
32MB and 128MB are twice the performance difference.
- reference : https://www.slideshare.net/Red_Hat_Storage/
ceph-performance-projects-leading-up-to-jewel-61050682

Closes-Bug: #1698249
Change-Id: I85f87c9b859c7ee4d3dfd3eade98896b24f1139a
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Support for increasing thread cache size in TCMalloc.

Currently TCMalloc's default tc size is 32MB.
This causes poor performance in ceph storage.
A new ceph_tcmalloc_tc_bytes option has been added
with a default of 128MB.

128 MB is default TC size at above jewel version.
and if we don't set this config,
osd daemon will running with 32 MB.
because 32MB is default size in TCmalloc 2.4 version.
32MB and 128MB are twice the performance difference.
- reference : https://www.slideshare.net/Red_Hat_Storage/
ceph-performance-projects-leading-up-to-jewel-61050682

Closes-Bug: #1698249
Change-Id: I85f87c9b859c7ee4d3dfd3eade98896b24f1139a
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

revisions:

'}]
commit_message:
Fix hostname in rabbitmq-clusterer.config

The hostname is determined when generating config files using
kolla-ansible, so it need to be replaced with one in /etc/hosts of a
rabbitmq container.

Change-Id: I1934b6b1c62330dde467b16705368c3b14fd4378

commit_message:
WIP Dockerfile to run ansible orchiestration

When we move to ansible orchiestration, we want it to run on k8s.
That means we need container with it.

Change-Id: I02bc0bc314ed29fae172cea189d064b4bbd2ff76

commit_message:
Helm Native Values Step 2.

This PS converts most of the rest of all_values.yaml
to helm parent values stored in the kolla-common chart.

commit_message:
WIP: Add support for HTTPS on external API network

This patch enables the use of HTTPS for the OpenStack API by
using HAProxy to provide TLS termination.  Both the configuration
and the documentation for the deployment guide are updated with
this optional feature.

This patch is still in progress.

Next step is to update the Keystone catalog entries with https://
instead of http:// for those services presenting with TLS.

For the initial patch, only the services that currently use
HAProxy will support TLS.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Fox <kevin@efox.cc>

Change-Id: I2ee6a379c424b2aaa7780dc412211496afe8f5b1

most of the remaining uses of kollakube.

commit_message:
Remove development environment

Halcyon is not actively maintained.  As a result, we need a
different approach to a development environment.  This first
step removes the existing unmaintained development environment.

Change-Id: Ib668ee372add42a43152252d993f8eaed0ddb261
Partially-Implements: blueprint devenv-taketwo

subject: WIP memcached operator
revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2017-01-23 22:52:17.000000000', 'files': ['operators/memcached/memcached_operator.py', 'helm/microservice/memcached-deployment/templates/memcached-deployment.yaml', 'operators/memcached/memcached_tpr.yaml', 'operators/memcached/memcached_operator.yaml', 'helm/kolla-common/templates/_common_svc.yaml'], 'message': 'WIP memcached operator

python based operator for memcached, includes 3 major components:
1. Kubernetes 3rd party object, which define MemcachedOperator kind
2. Kubernetes definition of memcached-operator. This object allows
   communication between some entity controlling entity, could be
   a human operator or some orchestration and memcached-operator
   executing agent.
3. Python script of memcached-operator execution agent. It monitors
   changes in the state of memcached-operator object and reacts
   accordingly.

Change-Id: Icbe68245e8ffc68a1617047c5aa34915d2404681
'}]
commit_message:
WIP memcached operator

python based operator for memcached, includes 3 major components:
1. Kubernetes 3rd party object, which define MemcachedOperator kind
2. Kubernetes definition of memcached-operator. This object allows
   communication between some entity controlling entity, could be
   a human operator or some orchestration and memcached-operator
   executing agent.
3. Python script of memcached-operator execution agent. It monitors
   changes in the state of memcached-operator object and reacts
   accordingly.

Change-Id: Icbe68245e8ffc68a1617047c5aa34915d2404681

commit_message:
Remove all -1 from setup_gate.sh

-1 is not something bash returns.  Instead return a nonzero
value > 0 as per POSIX standards.

Change-Id: I59b2e7de605ddce9adaa6caadd2238dffe207d1c

revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2017-02-02 18:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/horizon-upgrades.rst', 'helm/microservice/horizon-frontend-configmap/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-frontend-deployment/Chart.yaml', 'doc/source/kolla-kubernetes-horizon.dot', 'doc/source/kolla-kubernetes-horizon.png', 'helm/microservice/horizon-backend-deployment/Chart.yaml', 'kolla_kubernetes/service_resources.py', 'tests/conf/iscsi-all-in-one/kolla_kubernetes_config', 'helm/microservice/horizon-backend-svc/templates/horizon-backend-svc.yaml', 'tests/conf/ceph-all-in-one/kolla_kubernetes_config', 'helm/microservice/horizon-backend-svc/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-frontend-configmap/templates/horizon-frontend-configmap.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-frontend-svc/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-frontend-svc/templates/horizon-frontend-svc.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-deployment/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-svc/templates/horizon-svc.yaml', 'helm/all_values.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-backend-deployment/templates/horizon-backend-deployment.yaml', 'helm/microservice/horizon-frontend-deployment/templates/horizon-frontend-deployment.yaml'], 'message': 'Support rolling upgrades of horizon

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch set allows multiple versions of Horizon to be run on
Kubernetes in parallel. It adds a Horizon frontend with session
tracking that allows the browser to continue to use the Horizon
version it was started with.

Change-Id: Ib1d840aa10f02dfec6c89b7fa8a4fcf0ea204994
'}]
commit_message:
Support rolling upgrades of horizon

Horizon is a web application that is distributed between the web
server, and the web browser. If the web server is upgraded while
the application is still running on the web browser, unusual issues
can creep up.

This patch set allows multiple versions of Horizon to be run on
Kubernetes in parallel. It adds a Horizon frontend with session
tracking that allows the browser to continue to use the Horizon
version it was started with.

Change-Id: Ib1d840aa10f02dfec6c89b7fa8a4fcf0ea204994

  Kubernetes Operator Controller

The Kubernetes Operator container will execute the Controller
script consuming the yaml file 'operator.yaml'. 'operator.yaml'
will describe how the operator will run.

Change-Id: Ibbc9719455aa1d76a655fe73d22720ab765d191b
Partially-implements: blueprint operator-base
"}]
commit_message:
Kubernetes Operator base

This patch includes:
  Base Kubernetes Operator class - kubernetes-operator.
  Base Service Kubernetes Operator class - service-operator.
  Kubernetes Operator Controller

The Kubernetes Operator container will execute the Controller
script consuming the yaml file 'operator.yaml'. 'operator.yaml'
will describe how the operator will run.

Change-Id: Ibbc9719455aa1d76a655fe73d22720ab765d191b
Partially-implements: blueprint operator-base

This PS introduces fencing pod which:
1. Checks for status of kubernetes nodes
2. in case of a node failure it:
   2.1 Cleans CEPH locks
   2.2 Poweroff failed node via IPMI
   2.3 Clean up all Terminating PODs for faster failover

PartiallyImplements: blueprint kubernetes-toolbox

commit_message:
Fencing pod

This PS introduces fencing pod which:
1. Checks for status of kubernetes nodes
2. in case of a node failure it:
   2.1 Cleans CEPH locks
   2.2 Poweroff failed node via IPMI
   2.3 Clean up all Terminating PODs for faster failover

Change-Id: Iac47af9c9040f1128f0e5dbbb56bddbbaa15ecab
PartiallyImplements: blueprint kubernetes-toolbox

subject: Pull container tallballs into the gate
revisions:
[{'number': 34, 'created': '2017-03-27 19:02:47.000000000', 'files': ['tools/setup_gate_common.sh', 'tools/setup_gate_ceph.sh', 'tools/setup_kubernetes.sh', 'tools/setup_gate.sh'], 'message': 'Pull container tallballs into the gate

Pull containers from tarballs.oo to make gate more reliable.

This patch works by downloading the regitry from tarballs.oo, then
using the docker load operation to instantiate the tarballs.  Note
we use wget in this patch instead of curl as wget is far more reliable.

Depends-On: I7dcb6b2a8faf1ce74e10f73f6465f4c693031990
Change-Id: Ibc92755f20c4f4fcc1a0e13d7b2d58967a9dd5e9
'}]
commit_message:
Pull container tallballs into the gate

Pull containers from tarballs.oo to make gate more reliable.

This patch works by downloading the regitry from tarballs.oo, then
using the docker load operation to instantiate the tarballs.  Note
we use wget in this patch instead of curl as wget is far more reliable.

Depends-On: I7dcb6b2a8faf1ce74e10f73f6465f4c693031990
Change-Id: Ibc92755f20c4f4fcc1a0e13d7b2d58967a9dd5e9

commit_message:
Massive rework of the kolla-kubernetes docs

- Organize all the docs in an order that is easlier to read
- Shorten the quickstart and make AIO the default deployment
- Multinode will be considered 'advanced deployment'
- Remove unused docs

Change-Id: I544cbb422277b1dd3c3fecdfef67c496f92975d5

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic1b777cf7d665615dce8efe3a96235f9162fc3bb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
WSGI configuration missing directive

    WSGI configuration is missing the directive
    "WSGIApplicationGroup %{GLOBAL}" after
    WSGIProcessGroup" in the horizon template.
    Of all WSGI configuration templates it is
    the only one that does not have the
    "WSGIApplicationGroup" line.

    Closes-Bug: #1759488

Change-Id: Iccae0ddc00dffdb122aabca151f62c035a7b6f91

subject: Enable to use HA Kubernetes masters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-29 09:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['helm/microservice/haproxy-daemonset/templates/haproxy-daemonset.yaml', 'helm/service/haproxy/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/keepalived-daemonset/templates/keepalived-daemonset.yaml', 'helm/microservice/haproxy-daemonset/Chart.yaml', 'helm/microservice/haproxy-daemonset/requirements.yaml', 'helm/service/haproxy/requirements.yaml', 'services/haproxy/haproxy-configmap.yml.j2', 'helm/all_values.yaml', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml'], 'message': 'Enable to use HA Kubernetes masters

In the case of adding new k8s master replicas to an existing k8s cluster
for HA, a load balancer and reverse proxy need to be set up.
Run these helm charts which install Keepalived using a VIP contained in
'kolla_internal_vip_address' and reverse proxy for all services of
kolla-k8s, after configuring some files below.
cloud.yaml
- Assigning VIP to "external_vip" and "dns_name"
/etc/kolla/global.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_internal_vip_address"
- configure "api_interfase"
/etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
- Assigning IPs of master replicas to "kolla_kubernetes_masters"
- Enable "HAProxy variables"
kolla-kubernetes/helm/all_values.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
Enable binding to non-local IP addresses
$ echo "net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf
$ sysctl -p

The final step is to configure k8s for HA, e.g. configuring the reverse
proxy for kube-api, clustering etcd servers and so on(The full details
are beyond the scope of kolla-k8s, Refer to the following section
for further details: https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/high-availability/)).

You can install these helm charts without additional k8s master replicas
and configuring k8s for HA for a test.

Change-Id: Id1a3fb29c1822b40f4f55ad05b8699018cd44836
Partially-Implements: blueprint set-up-ha
'}]
commit_message:
Enable to use HA Kubernetes masters

In the case of adding new k8s master replicas to an existing k8s cluster
for HA, a load balancer and reverse proxy need to be set up.
Run these helm charts which install Keepalived using a VIP contained in
'kolla_internal_vip_address' and reverse proxy for all services of
kolla-k8s, after configuring some files below.
cloud.yaml
- Assigning VIP to "external_vip" and "dns_name"
/etc/kolla/global.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_internal_vip_address"
- configure "api_interfase"
/etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
- Assigning IPs of master replicas to "kolla_kubernetes_masters"
- Enable "HAProxy variables"
kolla-kubernetes/helm/all_values.yml
- Assigning VIP to "kolla_kubernetes_external_vip"
Enable binding to non-local IP addresses
$ echo "net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind=1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf
$ sysctl -p

The final step is to configure k8s for HA, e.g. configuring the reverse
proxy for kube-api, clustering etcd servers and so on(The full details
are beyond the scope of kolla-k8s, Refer to the following section
for further details: https://kubernetes.io/docs/admin/high-availability/)).

You can install these helm charts without additional k8s master replicas
and configuring k8s for HA for a test.

Change-Id: Id1a3fb29c1822b40f4f55ad05b8699018cd44836
Partially-Implements: blueprint set-up-ha

commit_message:
Enable the multi-node deployment

 1) add a label for network node
   kubectl label node <node name> kolla_network=true

 2) rebuild OVS microservices for network and compute node
   For network node
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-network
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-network
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-network

   For compute node
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-compute
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-compute
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-compute

 3) deploy microservices into each node
   To network node
   - neutron-dhcp-agent
   - neutron-l3-agent-network
   - neutron-metadata-agent-network
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-network
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-network
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-network

   To compute node
   - nova-compute
   - nova-libvirt
   - neutron-openvswitch-agent-compute
   - openvswitch-ovsdb-compute
   - openvswitch-vswitchd-compute

 4) remove br-ex from compute-node

 5) If “multi-node" option in cloud.yaml is false (= AIO
    deployment), OVS microserivces for compute node
    won’t be deployed to avoid duplicating deployment.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint multi-node-deployment
Closes-Bug: #1766831

Change-Id: I0c7a07ba0fef372f1e2762bcc41fdaff30a13609

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:41.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6cb85818f107513a91a891eb8905f0a9a54dc716
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I6cb85818f107513a91a891eb8905f0a9a54dc716
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I286299b3ef10c008e73900e0d08a461637796b67
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I286299b3ef10c008e73900e0d08a461637796b67
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 333, 'name': 'Isaku Yamahata', 'email': 'isaku.yamahata@gmail.com', 'username': 'yamahata'}, {'_account_id': 7921, 'name': 'Mike Kolesnik', 'email': 'mkolesni@redhat.com', 'username': 'mkolesni'}, {'_account_id': 17120, 'name': 'Manjeet Singh Bhatia', 'email': 'manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com', 'username': 'manjeets'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 26507, 'name': 'Michel Peterson', 'email': 'michel@redhat.com', 'username': 'mpeterson'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-05-28 14:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['networking_odl/tests/unit/l3/test_l3_odl_v2.py', 'networking_odl/l3/l3_odl_v2.py'], 'message': "Retry journal recording in L3

Since journal recording can fail, and is not run in the same
transaction as router/FIP operations, it will lead to the resource
(router or FIP) to remain altered while a journmal record hasn't been
created.

L3 Flavors should solve this issue comprehensively, but we need a
solution until it's stable, which can also be backported to stable
branches. Hence, this fix should address 99% or the cases.

Change-Id: Ibef0db9a58d86a85ffd948a35db983863999d319
Closes-Bug: #1738246
"}]
commit_message:
Retry journal recording in L3

Since journal recording can fail, and is not run in the same
transaction as router/FIP operations, it will lead to the resource
(router or FIP) to remain altered while a journmal record hasn't been
created.

L3 Flavors should solve this issue comprehensively, but we need a
solution until it's stable, which can also be backported to stable
branches. Hence, this fix should address 99% or the cases.

Change-Id: Ibef0db9a58d86a85ffd948a35db983863999d319
Closes-Bug: #1738246

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "identity_uri"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1], this patch replace
port 35357 with 5000 for "identity_uri".
For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I6c8bf103bc781d3566cf108077383dd976c3a948

commit_message:
Fix sudoers for Ceph

Since moving ansible to a virtualenv in the toolbox Ceph could not run
find_disks.

Change-Id: I8bce61887273f1c27ab79edec947d36a3aab3c48

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-01-11 10:07:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/flavor.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_utils.py'], 'message': 'Default some flavor fields loaded from instance

For whatever reason, the non-notification Flavor object
does not provide defaults for disabled, is_public or swap
fields even though the data model does.

Any versioned notifications using the FlavorPayload are
pulling those from the embedded instance.flavor, which
could have been migrated years ago, and might be missing
some fields from the embedded flavor (like these default
ones).

This makes sure that when the Flavor object is deserialized
these fields are checked and if they are not defined then
they are defaulted according to the data model.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I71cdf53cb1904af061216b9ed08b2ceed4aa46e4
Closes-Bug: #1739325
'}]
commit_message:
Default some flavor fields loaded from instance

For whatever reason, the non-notification Flavor object
does not provide defaults for disabled, is_public or swap
fields even though the data model does.

Any versioned notifications using the FlavorPayload are
pulling those from the embedded instance.flavor, which
could have been migrated years ago, and might be missing
some fields from the embedded flavor (like these default
ones).

This makes sure that when the Flavor object is deserialized
these fields are checked and if they are not defined then
they are defaulted according to the data model.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I71cdf53cb1904af061216b9ed08b2ceed4aa46e4
Closes-Bug: #1739325

commit_message:
base framework for cyborg client.

Include osc and httpclient lib codes.
In order to avoid reinvent the wheel, most of libs leverage
other openstack projects.

Use this command to list accelerators:
  # openstack accelerator list

ref:
  1. osc plugin
  https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/contributor/plugins.html#

Change-Id: I90e39267eca3e91ce30807e00525cf637211e29d

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:43.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If807d4aba6e1dac661f6a380f4309d4563510106
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If807d4aba6e1dac661f6a380f4309d4563510106
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Stop showing passwords when bootstrap script is ran

Currently this causes bash to echo all lines parsed
and executed; which makes it not so nicely output the
bootstrapping password.

This is not something we should encourage and have show
up in peoples logs or other so stop doing that.

Change-Id: Iac963a5df393d0359b4c8f93b8756ca168f6f193

subject: Only sync the local cell in superconductor mode
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-03-24 00:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': "Only sync the local cell in superconductor mode

When nova-manage db sync runs on cell1 in superconductor
mode, the [api_database]/connection config option isn't
set in the config file on purpose so the cell can't
reach the API database.

As a result, the db sync on the cell config can't hit
the API DB to sync cell0, which is not something we need
here anyway, but it results in an error message.

This tells the cell config db sync to just run it on the
cell database and not try to sync cell0.

Change-Id: Iac092762decd6de9e90e264f2998d255e8e40d00
"}]
commit_message:
Only sync the local cell in superconductor mode

When nova-manage db sync runs on cell1 in superconductor
mode, the [api_database]/connection config option isn't
set in the config file on purpose so the cell can't
reach the API database.

As a result, the db sync on the cell config can't hit
the API DB to sync cell0, which is not something we need
here anyway, but it results in an error message.

This tells the cell config db sync to just run it on the
cell database and not try to sync cell0.

Change-Id: Iac092762decd6de9e90e264f2998d255e8e40d00

commit_message:
Set workers=$API_WORKERS in glance-registry.conf

We use $API_WORKERS to throttle the number of workers
in other services but were not doing it for g-reg for
some reason, which by default will run ncpu workers
up to a limit of 8.

Change-Id: Idc81ce05546e6d625c10e2229256eafbe7c057a5
Closes-Bug: #1774781

commit_message:
Add flavor_id argument to router tests.

As neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py is used networking-odl for
functional tests, it ignores flavor data because flavor_id is not
included in hardcoded argument list.

Closes-Bug: #1769751

commit_message:
Adds read_only middleware

This patch adds a read_only middleware to swift. It gives the ability
to make an entire cluster or individual accounts read only.
When a cluster or an account is in read only mode, requests that would
result in writes to the cluser are not allowed.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I7e0743aecd60b171bbcefcc8b6e1f3fd4cef2478

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:08:35.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82c3b74bb0346fa1742a97c00f2b5f3fb26263e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I82c3b74bb0346fa1742a97c00f2b5f3fb26263e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 10:09:59.000000000', 'files': ['blazar/tests/test_context.py', 'blazar/context.py'], 'message': 'Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation

BlazarContext class raises an error when the class is instantiated
with unspported keys. The class is used as a context for RPC and
the RPC is implemented over oslo.messaging. If oslo.messaging
automatically adds a new key for the context, the RPC execution
fails since the new key is unexpected by BlazarContext and it
raises an error.

This patch relaxes the limitations in BlazarContext. If unexpected
keys are passed for the class instantiation, the class ignores the
keys.

Change-Id: Ibdca6eead0ee726bc10a07ee43e4ef10110d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1775363
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore keys unsupported by BlazarContext in its creation

BlazarContext class raises an error when the class is instantiated
with unspported keys. The class is used as a context for RPC and
the RPC is implemented over oslo.messaging. If oslo.messaging
automatically adds a new key for the context, the RPC execution
fails since the new key is unexpected by BlazarContext and it
raises an error.

This patch relaxes the limitations in BlazarContext. If unexpected
keys are passed for the class instantiation, the class ignores the
keys.

Change-Id: Ibdca6eead0ee726bc10a07ee43e4ef10110d23e2
Closes-Bug: #1775363

subject: Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 12:20:30.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/openstack/eslint-config-openstack.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack-dev/bashate.config', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/karma-subunit-reporter.config'], 'message': "Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos

The release process for official OpenStack components
now uses release requests using changes proposed to the
openstack/releases git repository. This allows peer review
of release requests, including version numbers, and run a
series of checks to make sure the release is likely to be
successful once the tag is pushed. The same process
supports the creation of additional repo branches as well.
This all ensures that releases are reported correctly on
the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags
directly or create branches directly. There were a number
of old QA deliverables with stale ACLs, let's fix them.

Change-Id: I5a098095d87945517fb066a9aa125a481a96118a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove direct tagging/branching for QA repos

The release process for official OpenStack components
now uses release requests using changes proposed to the
openstack/releases git repository. This allows peer review
of release requests, including version numbers, and run a
series of checks to make sure the release is likely to be
successful once the tag is pushed. The same process
supports the creation of additional repo branches as well.
This all ensures that releases are reported correctly on
the releases.openstack.org website.

As a result of this process, nobody needs to push tags
directly or create branches directly. There were a number
of old QA deliverables with stale ACLs, let's fix them.

Change-Id: I5a098095d87945517fb066a9aa125a481a96118a

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:07:15.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4660a35ff63f3f0212978dda668ba2cb08774e3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4660a35ff63f3f0212978dda668ba2cb08774e3a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Skip fetching the virtual size of block devices

In this latest episode of `Which CI job has lyarwood broken today?!` we
find that I464bc2b88123a012cd12213beac4b572c3c20a56 introduced a
regression in the nova-lvm experimental job as n-cpu attempted to run
qemu-img info against block devices as an unprivileged user.

For the time being we should skip any attempt to use this command
against block devices until the disk_api layer can make privileged
calls using privsep.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
        nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflicts due to the substantial refactoring of
_get_instance_disk_info via I9616a602ee0605f7f1dc1f47b6416f01895e025b,
for this change the test has been extended to provide valid XML via the
config classes.

Closes-bug: #1771700
Change-Id: I9653f81ec716f80eb638810f65e2d3cdfeedaa22
(cherry picked from commit fda48219a378d09a9a363078ba161d7f54e32c0a)
(cherry picked from commit 8ea98c56b647526aae7a786531e934eeee7a90a2)
(cherry picked from commit 43cac615f6a0a4399c7bf3dda6c2595749f27ace)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7c8264704ce7c570b981ed40dbe8c37321c170b1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-05 07:28:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/placement/objects/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': 'Re-base placement object unit tests on NoDBTestCase

The tests in test_resource_provider.py were originally subclasses of
test_objects._LocalTest because that provided the necessary basics for
testing versioned objects. Since the placement objects do not use RPC
and because these tests are very limited, this is not needed. The
tests have been changed to have NoDBTestCase as a grandparent with an
intervening parent class that sets self.context.

Where required, those tests which uses a database set USES_DB to True.
Subsequent patches will either remove or move these tests to functional
tests where they belong.

Change-Id: Ibf632cd3b4c0cf8fdff44a8a3272c637246f5b52
'}]
commit_message:
Re-base placement object unit tests on NoDBTestCase

The tests in test_resource_provider.py were originally subclasses of
test_objects._LocalTest because that provided the necessary basics for
testing versioned objects. Since the placement objects do not use RPC
and because these tests are very limited, this is not needed. The
tests have been changed to have NoDBTestCase as a grandparent with an
intervening parent class that sets self.context.

Where required, those tests which uses a database set USES_DB to True.
Subsequent patches will either remove or move these tests to functional
tests where they belong.

Change-Id: Ibf632cd3b4c0cf8fdff44a8a3272c637246f5b52

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:24.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifeed5b9c1357cbb00502c8c7d2932a5e2ad2e2a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifeed5b9c1357cbb00502c8c7d2932a5e2ad2e2a6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Install EPEL repositories manually and exclude Python packages

The EPEL repositories currently have conflicts with the OpenStack
RDO packages.  However, we don't need any Python packages from
EPEL therefore this will solve the conflicts and it will not
let it pull anything from EPEL.

Change-Id: I5fc6b4cbcd3d8ad207477603591f82ea8243a1c1

commit_message:

commit_message:
DNM Debug hosts

/etc/hosts is prepared for multinode, but its content does not help
with qemu name resultion during live migration.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/722649/

Debug to understand what's wrong (probably inventory names are injected
instead of proper hostnames.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/572313
Change-Id: Ib815cfe91af5bf9e526f57a2676008e8ce77975f

subject: [Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 09:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/fullstack/resources/config.py'], 'message': "[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)
"}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Limit number of Neutron's api workers

Default number of api workers in Neutron is set to be equal to
number of CPU cores on host. That is fine on production environment
but on fullstack tests, where each test spawns own neutron-server
process it might cause host overload.

This patch limits number of api_workers to 2 which should be enough
for single test case and should make significantly lower load on host.

Change-Id: I1e970e35883d5240f0bd30eaea50313d93900580
Closes-Bug: #1750337
(cherry picked from commit 465ad6f3197b8591a401a9f0db2fabf6c70fdfce)

subject: Don't share a network with all tenants
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 09:56:23.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/tempest/api/admin/test_shared_network_extension.py'], 'message': "Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571676/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209
"}]
commit_message:
Don't share a network with all tenants

Other tenants may appreciate random networks not popping up for
miliseconds in their net-list; and other test cases executed in parallel
may also benefit, especially when they e.g. attempt to validate net-list
result; or boot an instance w/o specifying a port or network to use.

There is still more work on tempest tests side.

Original patch was for neutron-tempest-plugin:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550987/
and this is only backport to stable/Pike branch which still
uses tempest tests from neutron repo.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571676/
Change-Id: I88eaa1bb65482557912c2d304800d782e730a6b6
Closes-Bug: #1753209

commit_message:
Fix eventlet imports issue

With Ubuntu python package 2.7.12-1ubuntu0~16.04.3 and
evetlet < 0.22.0 there is some issue with eventlet monkey_patching.
This commit adds workaround solution ported from eventlet patch
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/commit/b756447bab51046dfc6f1e0e299cc997ab343701

Change-Id: Ia381c98116765903bf2652acd175251233df4e54
Closes-Bug: #1745013
(cherry picked from commit 04efb3bca33cb4ca49f29e548866ad6f5d0ed359)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 10:24:55.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py'], 'message': "Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I54e3db4822830a0c83daf7b5150575f8d6e2497b
(cherry picked from commit d0fa2c9ac50a783c410fab2df938974c4e829ffa)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I54e3db4822830a0c83daf7b5150575f8d6e2497b
(cherry picked from commit d0fa2c9ac50a783c410fab2df938974c4e829ffa)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 18:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7f0cc773ddc6bdcf464574fc7faa9216db71e09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7f0cc773ddc6bdcf464574fc7faa9216db71e09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc418b2911ec09d1f7968ffb3d3e4093f6d07d6c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:59:48.000000000', 'files': ['qinling/utils/common.py'], 'message': "replace file() with open() for python 3 compatibility

The built-in name 'file' does not exist under python 3, so replace it
with 'open', which is the same under python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ic1ff9308b1ab0bda8d49a556620bb22ca5407b5e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
replace file() with open() for python 3 compatibility

The built-in name 'file' does not exist under python 3, so replace it
with 'open', which is the same under python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: Ic1ff9308b1ab0bda8d49a556620bb22ca5407b5e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-29 16:14:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/image/test_glance.py', 'cinder/image/glance.py'], 'message': "Adding image membership check to _is_image_available

This adds a condition for valid membership where the image visibility is
'shared', the current project matches a member_id of the image and that
member's status is 'accepted'.  If all of these conditions are true,
then the current project has access to the image.  This check is
performed after other checks since it requires querying for membership
information from Glance so it will only affect membership checks that
were likely to fail already (due to having failed all previous checks).

Change-Id: Ifdcf7c5eab435b0dc40dd3650b61ebfef1e5579e
"}]
commit_message:
Adding image membership check to _is_image_available

This adds a condition for valid membership where the image visibility is
'shared', the current project matches a member_id of the image and that
member's status is 'accepted'.  If all of these conditions are true,
then the current project has access to the image.  This check is
performed after other checks since it requires querying for membership
information from Glance so it will only affect membership checks that
were likely to fail already (due to having failed all previous checks).

Change-Id: Ifdcf7c5eab435b0dc40dd3650b61ebfef1e5579e

Change If1e34ea112b0cff328a58ec2fc9c3f5a5005f1c6 renamed the Google
backup driver, but the configuration docs for the driver were not
updated. This results in the incorrect driver name being provided
for backup driver configuration and local document builds failing

in the old location.

Change-Id: I40fa544892ed9ea9fb5975baeafb7c9a7e2f12a3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix GCS backup driver docs

Change If1e34ea112b0cff328a58ec2fc9c3f5a5005f1c6 renamed the Google
backup driver, but the configuration docs for the driver were not
updated. This results in the incorrect driver name being provided
for backup driver configuration and local document builds failing
due to no configuration options being found when looking for them
in the old location.

Change-Id: I40fa544892ed9ea9fb5975baeafb7c9a7e2f12a3

commit_message:
Add contributor docs on deprecating and removing compute REST APIs

Deprecating APIs with microversions is a long-established pattern
at this point, but the docs don't mention it at all, so this
adds a short description of what happens there.

We removed the os-certificates and os-cloudpipe APIs in Pike
and the os-fping API in Rocky, and there is a pattern to removal
also, so this adds detailed documentation on the steps involved
in removing a deprecated API.

Change-Id: I9fdb9ce78c45d27d3c7f55fcbda0f763dfb66d66

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-10 19:26:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/policies/__init__.py', 'api-ref/source/os-fping.inc', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-fping/fping-get-resp.json.tpl', 'api-ref/source/index.rst', 'nova/policies/fping.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_fping.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_fping.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/fping.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-remove-nova-network-api-removals-931ad60364f6f2a8.yaml', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/fping.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-fping/fping-get-details-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'nova/conf/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove support for /os-fping REST API

This drops support for the fping compute REST API which
has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

To match the os-cloudpipe and os-certificates removals
the os-fping controller now returns a 410 response.

The related fping_path configuration option is removed
along with the related fping policy rules.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample
test is just asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference
still builds from those and can be considered more or
less branchless, so people looking at the API reference
can apply it to older deployments of nova before os-fping
was removed.

A release note is started which we can build on for each
nova-network specific API that we remove in this series.

Part of blueprint remova-nova-network

Change-Id: Ia36aaa8f74adc2b540c49523db522cd85ab17ed2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for /os-fping REST API

This drops support for the fping compute REST API which
has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

To match the os-cloudpipe and os-certificates removals
the os-fping controller now returns a 410 response.

The related fping_path configuration option is removed
along with the related fping policy rules.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample
test is just asserting the 410 response now.

The API sample docs are left intact since the API reference
still builds from those and can be considered more or
less branchless, so people looking at the API reference
can apply it to older deployments of nova before os-fping
was removed.

A release note is started which we can build on for each
nova-network specific API that we remove in this series.

Part of blueprint remova-nova-network

Change-Id: Ia36aaa8f74adc2b540c49523db522cd85ab17ed2

subject: Test Django default test runner
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-05-06 21:25:37.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh'], 'message': 'Test Django default test runner

horizon blueprint improve-horizon-testing will change
the test runner from nose to the django default test runner.

This commit is to test the django default test runner.
The verbosity is increased to check which tests are executed.

After switching the test runner, the number of tests executed
will be changed from 349 to 348. The only difference is
manila_ui.tests.test_data.utils.load_test_data which has no
actual test. nose seems to recognize this as a test based on
its filename but this is not true, so this is not a problem.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/
Change-Id: I5aba373dc6ad0acb6a5e14dff3799d4caf64de23
'}]
commit_message:
Test Django default test runner

horizon blueprint improve-horizon-testing will change
the test runner from nose to the django default test runner.

This commit is to test the django default test runner.
The verbosity is increased to check which tests are executed.

After switching the test runner, the number of tests executed
will be changed from 349 to 348. The only difference is
manila_ui.tests.test_data.utils.load_test_data which has no
actual test. nose seems to recognize this as a test based on
its filename but this is not true, so this is not a problem.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544296/
Change-Id: I5aba373dc6ad0acb6a5e14dff3799d4caf64de23

commit_message:
Revert "Rename fernet_utils to token_utils"

This reverts commit 03ba867327fe950d3240fdbd6d207a8c0550e2c5.

Because of the introduction of auth receipts we will be
using fernet for more than just tokens. Lets make this a
generic util for fernet key handling.

Change-Id: I3a870a63239491f84db3350178bd2313eeccdbf3

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-06-01 22:47:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/exception.py', 'releasenotes/notes/nova-manage-placement-heal-allocations-13a9a0a3df910e0b.yaml', 'doc/source/cli/nova-manage.rst', 'nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'message': "Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

This will be useful beyond just getting deployments
off the CachingScheduler, however, since operators
will be able to use it to fix incorrect allocations
resulting from failed operations.

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21
"}]
commit_message:
Add nova-manage placement heal_allocations CLI

This adds a new CLI which will iterate all non-cell0
cells looking for instances that (1) have a host,
(2) aren't undergoing a task state transition and
(3) don't have allocations in placement and try
to allocate resources, based on the instance embedded
flavor, against the compute node resource provider
on which the instance is currently running.

This is meant as a way to help migrate CachingScheduler
users off the CachingScheduler by first shoring up
instance allocations in placement for any instances
created after Pike, when the nova-compute resource
tracker code stopped creating allocations in placement
since the FilterScheduler does it at the time of
scheduling (but the CachingScheduler doesn't).

This will be useful beyond just getting deployments
off the CachingScheduler, however, since operators
will be able to use it to fix incorrect allocations
resulting from failed operations.

There are several TODOs and NOTEs inline about things
we could build on top of this or improve, but for now
this is the basic idea.

Change-Id: Iab67fd56ab4845f8ee19ca36e7353730638efb21

commit_message:
Replace rabbitmq references with oslo messaging

This removes, everywhere applicable, the reference
_rabbitmq_, replacing it with the new oslo
counterpart. Shims for compatibility are explicitly
referenced, so that we can remove them later, when
the roles have been adapted appropriately.

It explicitly puts all the oslo messaging details
in one place, as this is easier to track. It is
applied on the all group, as most of the time, the
details are used by 2 or more roles.

This also updated spice-html5 git repository URL
as their code moved out of github. This also adds
some details in job log collection in order to be
able to gather more information about failures.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572413/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572565/
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/560574/
Change-Id: I1bab622e22d7d820fa2f774b4df60323b1eb7d1e

subject: Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-24 20:38:59.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/history.rst'], 'message': "Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs

The ChangeLog file is generated when we run `python setup.py sdist`,
which doesn't naturally happen when we run `tox -edocs`, so on a fresh
clone the docs build will fail because it references the ChangeLog file
which isn't there. Since we don't rely on pbr any more for release notes
and we have a sophisticated release note management tool, point the docs
at the published release notes instead of the pbr ChangeLog.

Change-Id: I614091eae739154337795a8f120b68686ad0ed0a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't rely on pbr ChangeLog for docs

The ChangeLog file is generated when we run `python setup.py sdist`,
which doesn't naturally happen when we run `tox -edocs`, so on a fresh
clone the docs build will fail because it references the ChangeLog file
which isn't there. Since we don't rely on pbr any more for release notes
and we have a sophisticated release note management tool, point the docs
at the published release notes instead of the pbr ChangeLog.

Change-Id: I614091eae739154337795a8f120b68686ad0ed0a

commit_message:
Remove references to internal PyKMIP implementation details

This change removes and replaces references to internal PyKMIP
implementation details with alternatives that support backwards
compatibility. These changes should be compliant with PyKMIP
0.7 (the current release) and PyKMIP 0.8 (the upcoming release).

Change-Id: I419680076a8eb43a98ef21474328ed8b4d267067

commit_message:
Fix node health validation with inventory changes

The inventory now uses host names in groups instead of IPs which cannot be
directly used to ping hosts in the node health validation.

The IPs are now collected from the meta hostvars dictionary.

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:06:36.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4382a110fbfb61c86157088ea31bd55c8bcbc53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4382a110fbfb61c86157088ea31bd55c8bcbc53
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Correct usage of transport_url in example

The example usage of transport_url in ConfFixture was not corrected when
the rest of the code was switched to using 'fake:/' for transport_url.
Since other projects will refer to this example to review changes, it
should be correct.

Also change the transport URLs used in test_transport to correspond to
the correct way of specifying virtual hosts.

Change-Id: If8e0a869e02fda2d8d2c86d82ef83ffc3a4361e4

commit_message:
Add warning output if failed to rebuild exception when deserialize

In some specific cases, the middleware would fail to rebuild
the original exception, see bug [1] below. Adding this output
may help locate the root cause quickly.

[1]: https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1728826

Change-Id: Ia9304bda4e515812b146885f830e70f28a285f2d

commit_message:
Revert "Add Zuulv3 jobs for puppet functional testing"

This reverts commit 0474b75e86fe8ade257bfea9b92cab9aed6ada1f.

Since the general consensus is to just keep puppet on life support
until we're ready for a new config management system, it's not
worth the effort to convert our beaker-rspec tests to a new thing.

change.

subject: Add optional support for retrying certain HTTP codes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-29 12:56:30.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'releasenotes/notes/status-code-retries-75052a43efa4edb2.yaml', 'keystoneauth1/adapter.py'], 'message': 'Add optional support for retrying certain HTTP codes

Ironic commonly returns HTTP 409 when a node is locked by another routine
and HTTP 503 when the conductor has no free threads to process the request.
Currently it is managed by custom code in ironicclient and openstacksdk,
this change will allow to move it to Session itself.

Change-Id: I04e356e7856b020cd20aa598e291ef31e02730d2
'}]
commit_message:
Add optional support for retrying certain HTTP codes

Ironic commonly returns HTTP 409 when a node is locked by another routine
and HTTP 503 when the conductor has no free threads to process the request.
Currently it is managed by custom code in ironicclient and openstacksdk,
this change will allow to move it to Session itself.

Change-Id: I04e356e7856b020cd20aa598e291ef31e02730d2

commit_message:
Add flag to enable QoS DSCP marking in ODL

In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP
marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through
VXLAN/GRE tunnels.

Add a flag in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight.

Change-Id: I3b192c8fc1bc92c1124d3b27c60ad5c0c4dd42f9
(cherry picked from commit bdd51e937ac81d789c50b0569cafde1d134632f8)

commit_message:
Add flag to enable QoS DSCP marking in ODL

In OpenDaylight, a config parameter is available to enable DSCP
marking inheritance for packets egressing out of OVS through
VXLAN/GRE tunnels.

Add a flag in TripleO to enable this parameter via puppet-opendaylight.

Change-Id: I3b192c8fc1bc92c1124d3b27c60ad5c0c4dd42f9

commit_message:
Add glance-eventlet-ssl-handshake-broken-py35 job

Blacklist the two currently skipped functional-py35 tests and
include them in a new non-voting job so that their failure is
obvious instead of hidden.

Change-Id: Ice8e114c6590b25f3ec79fbe4c06efaa245706c0
Partial-bug: #1769006

If the TaskServer RPC service is not started before the launcher waits
for its completion, then on shutdown it could result in a hang:

    WARNING oslo_messaging.server Possible hang: stop is waiting for start to complete

This is a port of the fix for Sahara bug #1546119.

Closes-bug: #1705543
'}]
commit_message:
Start task RPC service before waiting

If the TaskServer RPC service is not started before the launcher waits
for its completion, then on shutdown it could result in a hang:

    WARNING oslo_messaging.server Possible hang: stop is waiting for start to complete

This is a port of the fix for Sahara bug #1546119.

Change-Id: I083a85c2ff53364535ac8658677ffa69f4318593
Closes-bug: #1705543

commit_message:
Add table_exists in database upgrade script

Before creating tables in database, we should add table_exists in script
if table does not exist, start creating

Change-Id: Ic06a591e0337349a8fd0c6f88732310bbb5c3fc0
Closes-Bug: #1742019
